title: International Exchange Rate Fluctuations and Overseas Investment Decision-Making Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Learners perform international finance/accounting-related tasks within corporations, with the goal of real-world application. Utilizes team collaboration tools in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can calculate expected returns on overseas assets under uncertainty and make investment decisions.
Learners can analyze the correlation between exchange rate volatility and investment risk to develop risk management strategies.

Learners can perform collaborative decision-making in 3 international investment scenarios (stocks, bonds, forex) via team-based simulations (3–5 members) and submit reports meeting ≥4 of 5 evaluation criteria (rationality of decisions, team contribution, risk management).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
